meanings.definition: The result of overexertion or misuse of the eyes, causing discomfort or fatigue.
meanings.sent1: After staring at the screen for hours, I developed eyestrains and had to rest my eyes.
meanings.sent2: She experienced eyestrains after reading in dim light for too long.
meanings.sent3: The book was so captivating that it gave me eyestrains from reading late into the night.
meanings.sent4: His constant screen time led to eyestrains that felt like tiny weights on his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The bright sunlight caused immediate eyestrains, making it hard to keep my eyes open.

meanings.definition: To experience discomfort or fatigue in the eyes due to overexertion or misuse.
meanings.sent1: I often eyestrains when I spend too much time on my phone without breaks.
meanings.sent2: She eyestrains easily when she forgets to blink while working on the computer.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly claimed he could eyestrains from watching too many cat videos.
meanings.sent4: The intense study session made her eyestrains as if her eyes were running a marathon.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights in the room made it impossible not to eyestrains during the presentation.
